activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra L. Plumlee-Teach

records.addlTxt:
2:58 PM Defendant Debra L. Plumlee-Teach in court.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre in court for Debra L. Plumlee-Teach.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper states that Defense counsel has sent information to the DA office. Attorney Harper has a couple more question to asks of the officer and request a reset.  Court resets.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:59 AM Defendant Debra L. Plumlee-Teach in court.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre in court for Debra L. Plumlee-Teach.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Longacre has received the discovery and asks for another status. 

Attorney Longacre provides the court with the waiver of the preliminary hearing. Court speaks with DP about the waiver. Court binds over for trial. 

Court moves forward with the arraignment. Attorney Longacre enter NG pleas on all counts. Court reads the max penalties.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Judicial Review Request
Staying Administrative Suspension
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:16 PM Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video means for Defendant Debra L. Plumlee-Teach. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Debra L. Plumlee-Teach appeared by phone means. Attorney McDougal waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney McDougal waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing. DP agrees with waiving the timelimits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:29 PM Defendant Debra L. Plumlee-Teach appeared by phone means with Attorney McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal hasn't seen the complaint.

State would like to speak about bond. State asks for a signature bond with no drink provision. No objection from Attorney McDougal. Court orders $10,000 signature bond with condition defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
